item.title: Runaway horses gallop through central London, blazing a path of mayhem and injuries
item.description: Five military horses got spooked during a training exercise, bolting and weaving a path of destruction across the city before being captured. Several people and horses are being treated for injuries.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: No more noncompetes, FTC says; Tenessee bill would allow teachers to carry guns
item.description: The Federal Trade Comission voted yesterday to ban nearly all noncompete agreements. Tenessee's lawmakers have passed a bill allowing teachers to carry guns on campus.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: How do you get siblings to be nice to each other? Latino families have an answer
item.description: Over the past few decades, psychologists have begun to understand how parents across many cultures teach their children to build deep, fulfilling relationships with their siblings.

item.title: Most nursing homes don't have enough staff to meet the federal government's new rules
item.description: The new rules mean 4 out of 5 nursing homes will need more aides and nurses. Unions hailed the change, but advocates say it's not enough care, while nursing home owners say it's an "impossible task."

item.title: Tesla profits have plummeted. Elon Musk remains all-in on robotaxis
item.description: Tesla's sales are down. It's slashing car prices and laying off staff. Yet CEO Elon Musk remains bullish on a future that's self-driving and battery-powered.
